message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.CL 

The paper deals with handwritten Chinese character recognition using deep learning techniques, specifically convolutional neural networks and siamese neural networks. This falls under the computer vision (cs.CV) and machine learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper discusses the optimization of the siamese neural network, which involves binary classification, and the use of discriminative features, which are topics covered in the artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. The paper also mentions experiments performed on datasets, which suggests information retrieval (cs.IR) as another possible sub-category. Finally, the recognition of handwritten characters involves natural language processing (cs.CL) to some extent, as Chinese characters are a form of written language.
